comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Torreon, in northern Mexico was a scene of much fighting between rebels and federals in 1913-1914 and again in the rebellion of 1929.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.lib.utexas.edu/maps/atlas_mexico/constitutionalist_re... provides a map of Mexico with indicators of military activity by different groups during the "Constitutionalist Revolution" of 1913-1914. Torreon is shown as an area where Federal forces (in support of Huerta while he was president, February 18, 1913 – July 15, 1914) resisted the Revolutionary Army. Pancho Villa was the revolutionary leader who was active around Torreon. Other Bain photos of Federal at Torreon include: and

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
la foto 3033-12 (así como otras de distintas fechas) también tiene 3/7/29 (¿marzo 7, de 1929?). Tal vez se trate de la fecha de archivo o de publicación pero no de la toma.
Dr. Roberto Duarte.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
These three pictures most likely were taken arround April 4, 1914, not at Torreón, but at San Pedro, 62 kilometers north from Torreón.  Or at least were taken on April 1-2, before or when
the federals were fleeing from Torreón to San Pedro, hustled by Villa's troups.
Dr. Roberto Duarte¨
Plastic Surgeon
